item.title: #42 - Podcast #7 - Season Finale - Freedom, Focus and Mushrooms
item.description: Some final thoughts and notes about this podcast season. I will talk about removing YouTube channel, pausing my website development and trying to focus on other things. Topics will vary, such as bitcoin, crypto and biology.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #41 - Overview on My Blogging Systems
item.description: Details about my shell scripts that generate static webpages for this website. Some grew rather complex..
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #40 - Ksh2020 Flamewars
item.description: A little about ksh history. David Korn's ksh93u+ and v- are work of art and we should be respectful of the code base.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #39 - Not Quite Done Yet
item.description: I don't mean to be dramatic. I will leave some things up behind and try to move on..
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #38 - Going Away
item.description: Season Finale
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #37 - Firefox on Mobile (Android)
item.description: Firefox for Android is Buggy.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #36 - Firefox on NVIDIA Graphics Card
item.description: Configuring Firefox to use Nvidia card requires a lot of configuration and the outcome may be unstable. Patience and slow testing are essential to get a working configuration for the user system.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #35 - Removing Google Analytics
item.description: Planning to remove Google Analytics and some politics ramble..
item.category: vaccine/politics/try/tentativa/vaccination halt/suspensão da vacinação/car trip/family/vigagem de carro/família
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #34 - Bitcoin Graph Watch
item.description: A graph with markings from various sources which I put together and my thinking about diversification of assets..
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #33 - Podcast #6 - More Tor Configs for Bitcoin Node and SSH
item.description: Talk about IPv4, IPv6 and Onion networks, inbound and outbound connection types and how to help the network synchronising clearnet and onion networks. Also, I ramble a little about SSH (Secure Shell) to manage Unix systems at home.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #32 - First Vaccine Shot (Coronavac)
item.description: Yesterday I took my father for him to have his first vaccine shot against Covid. It was a fun day.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #31 - Arrgh! Internet Issues
item.description: Internet problems started about two weeks ago and only today I was able to confirm the problem was outside my home: it was the internet provider distribution equipament in my area. Internet speed is normalised, however that is not the end of the problems, yet..
item.category: tumblelog/internet provider/provedor de internet/bad equipament/signal noise/packet loss/ping/perda de pacotes/ruído de sinal/microblog
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #30 - Podcast #5 - Running a Bitcoin Full Node with Tor
item.description: Running a bitcoin full-relay node with Tor networking. Also, which web browser do I prefer for desktop and mobile systems: Firefox, Chrome or Opera? These are the subjects for the fifth episode of the podcast.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #29 - Sweeping Bitcoin Wallets and Low Fees
item.description: Trying to broadcast own transactions with low fees has many a stand but is not generally a difficult process to understand. Practice and patience are required to get low-fee transactions included in the blockchain. Persistence is a key word in this pursue.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #28 - Wrapping Up: What Happened, Afterall?
item.description: Evaluating the real factors that contributed for me feeling bad during the second harverst day on countryside fields with my work team.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #27 - Quick Notes on the First Job External Trip
item.description: Some quick notes on the first days of my new job in which we travelled far away and harvested some experimental crops..
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #26 - New Job
item.description: A new job and a new future: what is my new job like and what I am thinking about for my future as a biologist.
item.category: biology/genetically modified organisms/biologia/organismos geneticamente modificados/new job/novo emprego/futuro/future/plans/planos
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #25 - Podcast #4 - Ban, Sending
item.description: Notes for podcast episode number 4. Topics range from Bitcoin to being banned from FreeBSD forums `environmentalists', sending curriculum vitae copies and a shell RSS feeds for my website. Hopefully I can spare more topics than needed and pick the best ones..
item.category: topics/scripts/tópicos/bitcoin/volunteer work/trabalho voluntário/work/trabalho/confissões de biólogo/confessions of a biologist/nasa perseverance rover/commentaries/comentários/astronomy/astronomia/personal update
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #24 - List of Science-Related Confessions
item.description: A list with interesting `confessions', mostly from biologists or science aficionados. That is a good way to get inspired and remember what biology is attractive for..
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #23 - Banned from BSD Forums by Said Environmentalists
item.description: Are the BSD people an alternative or are they just like everybody else? Here is a repost of my original reply to their `Environmentalist' thread which got me banned unfairly.
item.category: environment/system fine-tuning/BSD/unfairness/sun/environmental forcings/biologist against environmentalists/science/biology/meio ambiente/ajust fino de sistema/injustiça/sol/forças do meio ambiente/biólogo contra ambientalistas/biologia/ciência
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #22 - Website Improvements, Shell RSS Feed Generator
item.description: Working with website code, improvements and ideas for an RSS feed generator written in shell scripting. This post is very useful for adding references and organising notes as I carry out this little project for the website..
item.category: rss feed/xml/atom/posting system/sistema de postagem/notícias/news/ideas/shell scripting/poor man webmaster tools
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #21 - Goals and Objectives for 2021
item.description: Reflexion on my (unpplaned) goals reached in 2020 and future plans.. Many expectations are made and trecherous roads ahead need heeding and courage if we are really to carry out our new objectives.
item.category: work/trabalho/vida/life/rotina/routine/intentions/intenções/expectation/expectativa/personal/pessoal/objetivos/metas/effort/esforço/2017/2018/2019/2020/2021/year-start goals/year-end goals/metas de fim de ano/metas de começo de ano/análise/auto-análise/analysis/autoanalysis
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #20 - Generating Graphs of Covid19 Positivity Rate
item.description: Generating graphs for covid19 test positivity with data from Brazillian OpenSUS Data. SUS is the Brazilian public health system. Data is badly gathered and distributed with many holes but we were able to extract some useful data from that.
item.category: covid-19/covid19/Sars-CoV-2/graphs/gráficos/test positivity/statistics/pcr tests/quick tests/brazil/brazillian data/dados brasileiros/sus/susopendata/dados da saúde/health/sars/respiratory syndrome/síndrome respiratória
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #19 - State Governor Response
item.description: After writing an e-mail about volunteer work to São Paulo State Governor, his particular secretary sent a `thanks' letter back to me. That was surprising and got my ego inflated. Unfortunately, the letter was all I eventually received.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #18 - Removing Important Files with `rm -r *'
item.description: That is easy to misuse the `rm' command and lose all your important files. In this blog article, I tell a story of a series of unfortunate events with `rm', recursion and globs.. Hopefully we have got a backup!
item.category: accident/linux/shell/glob/acidente/losing files/perdendo arquivos/removing file/removendo arquivos/deletando tudo/removing everything/deleting everything/error/mistakes/trapalhadas/micos/story/estória/história/regret/arrependimento/noob stuff/aprendendo/learning
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #17 - Podcast #3 - Auto Analysis, PIX Payments, Bitmex
item.description: Notes for the 2<sup>nd</sup> episode of the podcast. Subjects are about self analysis, brazilian payment system PIX, bitcoin, cripto, Bitmex wallets and more.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #16 - Biology for Cynics 0 - Saving the Wrong Species
item.description: The biologist casts doubt on biology basics. Hopefully you have lost the naïvité about biology.
item.category: teaching/class/basic science/notions/life/biology laws/Kuznets/protection of species/extinction/genesis/ensinar/classe/aula/ciência básica/cínicos/noções/céticos/skeptical/vida/leis da biologia/proteção de espécies/extinção/gênese/carbono/carbon/pollution/poluição/valor da vida/life value
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #15 - Moved on
item.description: There are times when we go down the memory lane and get upset. After reviewing it, we must move on for our own health.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #14 - Podcast Première and Episode #2 -
item.description: Planning of topics for the podcast première and also for the the second episode. Some of the subjects: Sir Attenborough, World Hunger, MOSAiC Expedition, Boy Plunger, Wallet and File Cryptography on Linux
item.category: environment/politics/meio ambiente/política/commentary/news/bbc/Prince William/Sir David Attenborough/Earthshot prize/bitcoin/cryptocurrency/podcast episode/us government/bitmex/bitfinex/encryption/keys/private keys/tips/dicas governo dos estados unidos/criptografia/criptomoedas
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #13 - Saving Bugs and Other Animals
item.description: How I save bugs and some tips for avoiding hitting animals while travelling through roads and highways.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #12 - Spell Checking Programmes
item.description: Choosing amongst some CLI spell checker options for Linux.. When working with plain text files, we need them, even though Vim can use them, too.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #11 - Blogs and Books
item.description: References for some interesting blogs to explore, some photos of my books and my plans for studying environmental law and applying to public contests.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #10 - Flying Memphis Belle, a B-17 Air Fortress
item.description: Mr Walter tells us how it was to fly aboard Memphis Belle as a war photographer. Story time!
item.category: war tribute/military story/tibuto militar/in memorian/história militar/estados unidos da américa/blaacky/adventures/soldier/soldado/aventuras/honor/honour/honra/ar/céu/air/aircraft/aeronave
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #9 - What Causes Forest Fires?
item.description: List of various possible causes of forest fires (natural or human-specific causes). The media only seems to think `humans' are to blame.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #8 - Good References, a Structure to Climb
item.description: Finding and selecting good people as references is hard. I try to keep the highest standards when it comes to choosing my idols, usually though we must take the best of any certain individual and make it our own.
item.category: references/scientists/referências/cientistas/achar referências/estrutural racional/rational structure/using other people work/building upon others/construindo em cima de gigantes
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #7 - CSS é Legal!
item.description: Having fun with CSS is a great way to dodge hangover. We would prefer not having a hangover but..
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #6 - More Web Master Resources
item.description: What a personal website can be useful for and how to manage it with shell scripting and some C blobs.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #5 - Using Poor Man's Web Master Tools
item.description: Thoughts on a Poor Man's Webmaster Tools (scripts) and web development hacks and the UNIX way of doing things.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #4 - Podcast Idéia
item.description: Checking Luke Smith's website, I got the idea of a Podcast! But most episodes, if not all, shall be in Portuguese while I haven't got a big enough foreign audience and confidence to record in English.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #3 - Blog Design
item.description: Concepts and ideas for the layout of of my personal website. That is rather a hard decision to make..
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #2 - English & Português
item.description: I am wondering how to make a bilingual website. It is a little trick as I don't want to duplicate and translate everything..
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #1 - Sync an HTML Blog!
item.description: Setting up an html webpage and the first blog post about it.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)

item.title: #0 - O Espelho (The Mirror)
item.description: This is an account of my experiences in Japan I wrote before going back to Brazil from Japan circa 2006. The text was republished by ShigeS on his trip website. As time went on, my original text was removed so I cloned the webpage to make it available over here.
item.author: jamilbio20@gmail.com (JSN)
